subject: Programming
title: RAM and Short-Term Memory
description: A short lesson to help you apply RAM and Short-Term Memory.

hook.text: Close a program without saving and your work vanishes. That's RAM losing power.

buildup.text: RAM is volatile memory. It holds data only while electricity flows through it.

discovery.text: Every running program, open tab, and clipboard item lives in RAM until you close it.

twist.text: RAM is fast but expensive. Your phone has 8 GB of RAM but 256 GB of slower storage.

climax.text: RAM is the brain's working memory â€” fast, limited, and gone the moment power cuts.

punchline.text: RAM remembers only while the power stays on.

quiz.question: What happens to RAM when power is lost?
